author: Staff Reporter
text:
Fearing that he could be arrested for stealing cows, a 42-year-old autorickshaw driver ended his life by jumping in front of a passenger train at Vazhapadi here on Monday.

A couple Chinnadurai and Poongodi in Vazhapadi were having cattle in the backyard of their house. On Sunday night, an unidentified person took away their two cows. Neighbours caught him and beat him. He was identified as T. Sudhakar (32) of Umayapuram, a middleman involved in selling cows. He said that Sivakumar of Pudupalayam had asked him to steal the cows. The police began inquiring Sivakumar that revealed his role. Hence, fearing arrest, he started to run away. While nearing a railway track, he jumped before the Virudhachalam – Salem passenger train and committed suicide.
title: Man ends life fearing arrest
